Evidence_Assessment: CRA's need for verification justifies scope; confidentiality not a valid ground for non-disclosure
Legal_Rule: Minister may require foreign-based information relevant to tax administration
Procedural_Issue: Validity of the Requirement under ITA
Grounds_for_Claim: Overly broad, irrelevant, confidential nature of requests
Outcome_on_Merits: Requirement upheld as reasonable and necessary
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature and scope of requested information, relevance to transfer pricing
Applicant_Challenge: Requirement is unreasonable due to breadth, irrelevance, confidentiality
Defendant_Response: CRA justified request for verification purposes
Decision_Authority: Federal Court or Tax Court of Canada
Remedy_Sought: Judicial invalidation of CRA's information requirement
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Challenge to validity of information requirement
Governing_Rule: ITA subsection 231.6 allows Minister to require foreign-based information relevant to tax administration
